column4: Everytime I want to restart ubuntu I have to click on the restart icon twice, first click shuts down all applications and nothing happens, second click restarts ubuntu, is there any solution for this ?
it sounds like the shutdown is hanging
what happens when you do "sudo reboot" in the terminal?
try creating a test user account, and reboot via GUI from there and see if the problem persists
I understand... I'm ruling out whether or not is has to do with your user account specifically.
ok so it's specific to your profile
how big of a deal would it be to reset your profile?
i'm afraid i don't know where exactly to look
you know in your home directory, there's a bunch of hidden folders like .nautilus, .gtk*, .gnome, .gnome2, right?
i know the setting is in one of those somewhere
for how the restart button behaves
basically, the entire look and feel of your desktop environment is contained throughout those folders
so my feeling is either a program specific to your session is hanging or there's a messed up setting
try gconf-editor (run from terminal or "Run Command"
